title: Pancho Gonzales
summary: Ricardo Alonso "Pancho" González (May 9, 1928 – July 3, 1995), known sometimes as Richard Gonzales, was an American tennis player. He won 14 major singles titles, including two U.S. National Singles Championships in 1948 and 1949 and 12 Professional Grand Slam titles. He also won three Tournament of Champions professional events in 1957, 1958, and 1959. He was the dominant professional of the 1950s, winning world professional championship tours of various types between 1954 and 1961; he was ranked world No. 1  in some rankings between 1952 and 1961.[2]
